intro: Rondeletia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a glossy texture.
